content: This is a great game. I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because of a bug involving the touch screen not scaling properly. If this happens on your device, the game will be unplayable because the touch controls won't register properly. They really should put a patch out there to fix this. I know for a fact this bug is on Nexus 6p, but I think it happens on some other newer android devices as well.  Good news! There is a work around. You need to hide the menu bars/drawers at the top and bottom of your screen when you start the Baldur's Gate II app. I used a free one from the play store called GMD Full Screen Immersive Mode. Use this to hide the bars, start Baldur's Gate II, and then you can use the touch controls on the game properly, as they scale correctly once you've hidden the bars. You can then unhide the bars if you prefer. You just need them hidden when you open Baldur's Gate II.  I hope this helps people who are having problems with touch controls, and are looking for help troubleshooting this bug.
